meanings.definition: A person or group that initiates something.
meanings.sent1: The initiators of the project were excited to get started.
meanings.sent2: The initiators of the plan gathered everyone for a meeting.
meanings.sent3: The initiators of the surprise party had to keep it a secret.
meanings.sent4: She was the initiator of the book club, sparking a love for reading in others.
meanings.sent5: The initiators of change often face challenges but also bring progress.

meanings.definition: A substance that starts a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The initiators in the experiment caused the reaction to begin.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use initiators to kickstart chemical processes.
meanings.sent3: The initiators in the solution made the colors change unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The initiator in the mixture acted like a catalyst, speeding up the reaction.
meanings.sent5: Adding initiators to the mixture was the key to starting the reaction.

meanings.definition: A device that starts a process or action.
meanings.sent1: The initiators in the machine triggered the sequence of events.
meanings.sent2: Pressing the button on the initiator activated the mechanism.
meanings.sent3: The initiator on the remote control made the toy car zoom forward.
meanings.sent4: The initiator on the timer set off the fireworks display.
meanings.sent5: The initiators on the control panel were essential for launching the rocket.
